message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Quick Assets for the Quick Ratio.  
• Cash on Hand: 627601.28  
• Bank Deposits: -129032.26  
• Interest Receivable: 13240.11  
• Accounts Receivable: 15362611.64  

First, sum Cash on Hand and Bank Deposits:  
 627601.28 + (–129032.26) = 498569.02  

Then add Interest Receivable:  
 498569.02 + 13240.11 = 511809.13  

Finally, add Accounts Receivable:  
 511809.13 + 15362611.64 = 15874420.77  

Step 2: Calculate Total Current Liabilities (from the balance sheet):  
• Accounts Payable: 2000000.00  
• Taxes Payable: 1143833.89  
Total Current Liabilities = 2000000.00 + 1143833.89 = 3143833.89  

Step 3: Compute the Quick Ratio using the formula:  
 Quick Ratio = Quick Assets / Total Current Liabilities  
 Quick Ratio = 15874420.77 / 3143833.89 ≈ 5.05  

Step 4: Calculate the Net Profit Margin.  
From the income statement:  
• Net Profit: 1938987.47  
• Total Revenue: 22876677.56  

Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100  
 = (1938987.47 / 22876677.56) × 100  
 ≈ 0.0847 × 100  
 ≈ 8.47%  

Final Answer in JSON format:

{
  "solution": {
    "Quick Ratio": "5.05",
    "Net Profit Margin": "8.47%"
  }
}
